body_html:
@drpngx I've installed tensorflow-0.12.1 in windows as described here with the command pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/windows/cpu/tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl.
After the installation is complete, I can't find the configure file in
C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\tensorflow.

Below is the package information I'm getting from pip.

> C:\WINDOWS\system32>pip show tensorflow
> Name: tensorflow
> Version: 0.12.1
> Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
> Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
> Author: Google Inc.
> Author-email: opensource@google.com
> License: Apache 2.0
> Location: c:\program files\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
> Requires: numpy, wheel, protobuf, six
body_text:
@drpngx  I've installed tensorflow-0.12.1 in windows as described here with the command pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/windows/cpu/tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl.
After the installation is complete, I can't find the configure file in
C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\tensorflow.
Below is the package information I'm getting from pip.
> C:\WINDOWS\system32>pip show tensorflow
> Name: tensorflow
> Version: 0.12.1
> Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
> Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
> Author: Google Inc.

> Location: c:\program files\anaconda3\lib\site-packages

body:
@drpngx  I've installed tensorflow-0.12.1 in windows as described [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md) with the command `pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/windows/cpu/tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl`.
After the installation is complete, I can't find the configure file in 
C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\tensorflow.

Below is the package information I'm getting from pip.

```
> C:\WINDOWS\system32>pip show tensorflow
> Name: tensorflow
> Version: 0.12.1
> Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
> Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
> Author: Google Inc.
> Author-email: opensource@google.com
> License: Apache 2.0
> Location: c:\program files\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
> Requires: numpy, wheel, protobuf, six
```
